results.title: Starting up, moving off and stopping
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “How to Drive”.
Safe driving techniques begin even before the engine is started. Demonstrates good habits to acquire on entering the car: checking the driving position, the seat belt and all-round visibility. The procedures involved in starting, moving off and stopping are shown; confidence and ability can now be gained by practice.

results.title: Inspecting the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “How to Drive”.
Good driving depends on good habits and a quick daily inspection as well as regular maintenance of those items which directly affect safety is the first good habit to develop. Demonstrates a quick and easy method of checking items, by starting at the driver’s door and walking anti-clockwise around the car.

results.title: Understanding the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”
Some knowledge of how a car works is a good basis for the intelligent use of its controls, and that is an early important step towards becoming a good driver. A car is built, pictorially, in simple stages, and how each component operates is explained in simple terms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Skidding
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Every driver should aim to drive and control their vehicle so that skidding never occurs. A skid ocurs when any of the three forces acting upon a car in motion - acceleration, braking, steering - is increased sufficiently to overcome the grip of the tyres on the road. Rear wheel, front wheel and four-wheel skids are shown and the right corrective action for each one. Also the types of road surfaces which tend to produce skidding.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Remembering it all
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Makes a recapitulation of all the points given in the previous eleven films, to show the responsibilities undertaken by a driver to check his car for roadworthiness, and to drive in a sensible, considerate manner by following the system of car control. Features First Constable Geoff Caine as The Driver.

results.title: Night driving
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
If your vision is normal and the lighting equipment of your car is in efficient working order, there is nothing to be scared of in night driving. The same section of road from a driver’s viewpoint is shown by day and by night, pointing out the different methods of detecting various features which will affect course and speed in night driving.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.
